abort.already_configured: This account has already been configured.

error.cannot_connect: Cannot connect to device. Confirm the IP Address is correct then try again.
error.invalid_auth: Failed to authenticate with device. Confirm the Device Id and Local Key are correct.
error.entity_already_configured: This entity has already been configured.
error.address_in_use: TCP port 6668 (used for discovery) is already in use. Check no other integration is using it.
error.discovery_failed: Something failed when discovering devices. See log for details. If problem persists, create a new issue (including debug logs).
error.empty_dps: Connection to device succeeded but no datapoints could be found. Please try set-up again. If problem persists, create a new issue (including debug logs).

user.title: Cloud API account configuration
user.description: Configure the credentials used to connect to the Tuya Cloud API.

abort.already_configured: This account has already been configured.
abort.no_entities:
Cannot remove all entities from a device.
If you want to delete a device: Browse to `Devices & services` menu, search for your device in `Devices` tab, click the 3 dots in the `Device info` frame, and press the `Delete` button.

error.cannot_connect: Cannot connect to device. Confirm the IP Address is correct then try again.
error.invalid_auth: Failed to authenticate with device. Confirm the Device Id and Local Key are correct.
error.entity_already_configured: This entity has already been configured.
error.address_in_use: TCP port 6668 (used for discovery) is already in use. Check no other integration is using it.
error.discovery_failed: Something failed when discovering devices. See log for details. If problem persists, create a new issue (including debug logs).
error.empty_dps: Connection to device succeeded but no datapoints could be found. Please try set-up again. If problem persists, create a new issue (including debug logs).

yaml_import.title: Not supported
yaml_import.description: Devices configured using `YAML` cannot be configured in the UI. Delete your device from `YAML` and re-create it in the UI or modify your `YAML` configuration.

add_device.title: Choose device to configure
add_device.description: Compatible Tuya devices on your local network are discovered automatically once they have been set-up in the Tuya app. If you can't see the device you expected, choose `Add device manually` from the dropdown.

edit_device.title: Reconfigure existing device
edit_device.description: Select the device you wish to re-configure.

configure_cloud.title: Manage Cloud API account
configure_cloud.description: Configure the credentials used to connect to the Tuya Cloud API.

configure_device.title: Configure device connectivity
configure_device.description: Configure any device details{for_device} that are empty (if any) to allow LocalTuya to connect to the device.

data.enable_debug: Enable debug (must be manually enabled in `configuration.yaml` too)
data.scan_interval: (Optional) Scan interval in seconds, if not scanning automatically
data.manual_dps_strings: (Optional) Manual DPS's, if not detected automatically (separated by commas)
data.reset_dpids: (Optional) DPIDs to send in RESET command, if device does not respond to status requests after turning on (separated by commas)
data.device_sleep_time: (Optional) Device sleep time in seconds: If the device reports its state, then it goes into sleep

device_setup_method.title: Configure device entities
device_setup_method.description: LocalTuya will try to discover the rest of the configuration automatically. However, if this does not work for your device or you would like to tweak settings, choose the `manual` option.

auto_configure_device.title: Auto configure
auto_configure_device.description: An error occurred: {err_msg}. If reason isn't showing, check logs.

pick_entity_type.title: Entity type selection
pick_entity_type.description: Choose the type of entity you want to add.

choose_template.title: Import template file
choose_template.description: Template files are located in the `templates` directory ([More Info](https://github.com/xZetsubou/hass-localtuya/discussions/13)).

configure_entity.title: Configure entity
configure_entity.description: Please fill out the details for {entity} with type {platform}. All settings (except for `Type` and `ID`) can be changed from the `Configure` page later.

data.stop_switch_dp: (Optional) Stop switch (if the cover has continue command?)
data.span_time: Full opening time, in secs. (for *timed* mode only)
data.fan_speed_ordered_list: Fan speed list (overrides speed min/max), separate entries by comma ','
data.restore_on_reconnect: Restore the last value set in Home Assistant after lost connection?
data.is_passive_entity: Passive entity? (requires integration to send initialisation value)
data.entity_category: Show the entity in this category
data.color_mode_set: Supported modes set (Leave as default if you aren't sure)
data.reset_timer: (Optional) Interval timer to reset state to off

data_description.hvac_mode_set: Each line represents [ hvac_mode: device_value ] [Supported HVAC Modes](https://developers.home-assistant.io/docs/core/entity/climate/#hvac-modes)
data_description.hvac_action_set: Each line represents [ hvac_action: device_value ] [Supported HVAC Actions](https://developers.home-assistant.io/docs/core/entity/climate/#hvac-action)
data_description.preset_set: Each line represents [ device_value: friendly name ]
data_description.scene_values: Each line represents [ device_value: friendly name ]
data_description.select_options: Each line represents [ device_value: friendly name ]
data_description.swing_modes: Each line represents [ device_value: friendly name ]
data_description.swing_horizontal_modes: Each line represents [ device_value: friendly name ]
data_description.alarm_supported_states: Each line represents [ supported state: device value ] [Supported States](https://developers.home-assistant.io/docs/core/entity/alarm-control-panel/#states)
data_description.humidifier_available_modes: Each line represents [ device_value: friendly name ]
data_description.fan_speed_list: Each line represents [ device_value: friendly name ]
